column9: Retired USMC after 24 years with an extremly bad temper and severe PTSD flashbacks during the day as well as sleeping! Tried many other meds. None worked! After today, I will gradually take him off of Valproic Acid myself.

column9: Was prescribed valproic acid after a psychotic break arrested with lithium and prozac.  Initially diagnosed with depression, subsequently altered to bipolar disorder. Went off medication for 3 months, had a manic episode characterized by wild overspending and other dangerous behaviors.  Resumed medication regimen and brought symptoms under control within 3 weeks.  I have had good success with this medication.

column9: In the beginning this medication worked great for my Bipolar/ Manic Depression. My only complaint was the indigestion it gave me. I started gaining a lot of weight and my hair started falling out at around 4 months. I have gained 35 lbs in 5 months and lost over half my hair by the time my doctor told me to stop this medication. I had decreased my dose to 1/4 mgs until I could see her. This caused me to become more anxious than ever and began having bad anxiety attacks. Been off it for 2 weeks and my hair is still falling out really bad. My pharmacist suggested I take AG Pro (behind the counter at Wal-Mart but non-prescription). I am extremely unsatisfied with this medication and wish I had never started taking it.

column2: pmiller012345@yahoo.com, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was on Depakote 250 Extended Release on the East Coast.  Had been taking it with no problems for years in conjunction with 2 mg of klonopin.  Went West and the drug store and they dispensed this drug as a generic for depakote.  Very bad reaction, incuding inability to walk, tremors, shaking etc.  This came in a large oval pill, produced as depakene on the label, the pill had "Devil" or something similiar imprinted on it by the drug company.  Those who have taken Depakote on the East Coast should be careful when changing to this "generic" - same for the klonopin I was taking - it changed to a green rather than blue pill in the West (Colorado).  Generics are not always the same as the brand name - depakote has two generics that are actually chemically different.

column2: thspaceman, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: This drug should not be given to any epileptic.This drug has caused many problems.I have been taking for many years.Effects have never been told, only liver, which count is starting to fall.I intend to see a neurologist immediatly to be taken off this drug. I have had epilepsy since i was twelve, and many types of drugs. I have all three types of epilepsy, and now reaching towards 50, and never going any length of time without seizures, one neurologist increased the dosage...and i didnt have the sense god gave me to look this drug up. If your doctor suggests putting you on this drug, ask for an alternative, i currently take 1250mg in morning and at night, as well as lamactogine and lorazepam. This drug does no good for anyone with our disability, please dont think that this drug will control your seizures. Thank YouLeonard K. Collins

column1: Seizures with Breaks in Consciousness &amp; Other Symptoms
column2: Tom, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I switched to Depakote in 1999 on learning that Dilantin made me dizzy.  I stopped taking Depakote for almost 30 days in December 2005 when I learned my insurance for the year had topped-out and a 1 mo supply would cost me $125.  I foolishly believed I bcould go a month with no Depakote until my Rx coverage kicked-in again January 2006.  Around Christmas 2005 my wife noticed i was having minor seizures that I did not even recognize at the time.  After about two weeks of symptoms reappearing, i mentioned to my wife "oh, by the way, I've temporarily stopped taking the Depakote."  She immediately saw the connection. We asked our doctor if a generic, less costly, form was available, and I immediately switched to Valproic Acid, 2 250 mg caps 3 times a day.  With attention to exercise, sleep and diet, I've had no problems since.
